item.title: Sensors in Robotics: How Ultrasonic, LiDAR, and IMU Work
item.description: Sensors are to robots what eyes, ears, and skin are to humans—but with far fewer limits. While we rely on just five senses, robots can be equipped with many more, sensing distances, movement, vibrations, orientation, light intensity, and even chemical properties.

item.title: Debugging a Robot In Simulation Before You Burn Wires
item.description: Hardware does not come with an undo button. Once you power it on, mistakes—from reversed wiring to faulty code—can result in costly damage.
